etymology.description: 椰(coconut) + 奶(milk) = coconut milk (liquid from coconut flesh).
etymology.interpretation: Refers to the rich white liquid expressed from grated coconut flesh, common in desserts and curries. Distinct from 椰子水, the clear liquid inside a fresh coconut.

parts.english: coconut; coconut palm; palm tree; coconut-related

examples.chinese: 我喜欢喝椰奶(我喜歡喝椰奶)。
examples.english: I like to drink coconut milk.

examples.chinese: 这道咖喱用椰奶增添香味(這道咖哩用椰奶增添香味)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè dào gālí yòng yēnǎi zēngtiān xiāngwèi.
examples.english: This curry uses coconut milk to add aroma and flavor.

examples.chinese: 别把椰奶和椰子水混淆(別把椰奶和椰子水混淆)。
examples.pinyin: Bié bǎ yēnǎi hé yēzi shuǐ hùnxiáo.
examples.english: Don't confuse coconut milk with coconut water.
